rules: Rule1: In the event that the financial product qualifies for a government grant, it becomes eligible for a tax credit.

Rule2: If the manufacturer submitted an application for phase 1, then should it not be the case that either solar panels use silicon as a renewable material or the natural reserve is located in a protected area, the financial product qualifies for a government grant.
Rule3: The manufacturer submitted an application for phase 1 or submitted an application for phase 2.

Rule4: Provided that the manufacturer submitted an application for phase 2, if it is not true that either solar panels use silicon as a renewable material or the natural reserve is located in a protected area, then the financial product qualifies for a government grant.
Rule5: Whenever solar panels complete durability testing, then if they meet the condition of being eco-certified, they use silicon as a renewable material.
Rule6: Assuming solar panels complete efficiency testing, then meeting the condition of being eco-certified implies that they use silicon as a renewable material.
Rule7: If solar panels pass quality checks at lab 1, then they have completed durability testing.
Rule8: Either solar panels pass quality checks at lab 1 or they pass quality checks at lab 2.
Rule9: In cases where solar panels pass quality checks at lab 2, they have completed efficiency testing.
Rule10: Should the manufacturer implement a lead-free alternative, then electronic devices do not contain hazardous lead.
Rule11: The manufacturer implemented a lead-free alternative or has an alternative pending approval.
Rule12: Solar panels meet the condition of being eco-certified or are manufactured in a natural reserve.
Rule13: If the manufacturer has an alternative pending approval, then the regulatory body is reviewing that alternative.
Rule14: Whenever the regulatory body is reviewing the alternative, electronic devices do not contain hazardous lead.
Rule15: In the event that solar panels are manufactured in a natural reserve, the natural reserve is located in a protected area.
Rule16: If the financial product qualifies for a green subsidy, then if solar panels meet the condition of being eco-certified, they use silicon as a renewable material.
Rule17: The financial product qualifies for a green subsidy or requires approval from a regulatory body.
Rule18: If the financial product requires approval from a regulatory body, then the regulatory body passes the solar panel in inspection.

Rule19: Electronic devices contain hazardous lead, or if the regulatory body passes the solar panel in inspection, then if solar panels meet the condition of being eco-certified, they use silicon as a renewable material.
Rule20: The manufacturer has a recycling program or electronic devices do not contain hazardous lead.

Rule21: In the event that it is not the case that either solar panels use silicon as a renewable material or the natural reserve is located in a protected area, then the financial product is not eligible for a tax credit.
Rule22: If it is not true that if electronic devices contain hazardous lead then they meet safety standards, then the manufacturer receives a penalty.
facts: Fact1: It is not the case that solar panels use silicon as a renewable material.
Fact2: The manufacturer does not receive a penalty.
Fact3: The manufacturer does not have a recycling program.
Fact4: Electronic devices do not meet safety standards.

question: The natural reserve is located in a protected area.
